content.title: Error: ENOSPC: no space left on device, write
content.body:
View details in Rollbar: [https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/31](https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/31)

```

Error: ENOSPC: no space left on device, write
  File "node:fs", line 2367, in Object.writeFileSync
  File "node:fs", line 2448, in Object.appendFileSync
  File "C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Local\Programs\youtube\resources\app.asar\src\index.js", line 312, in Object.info
  File "C:\Users\alpha\AppData\Local\Programs\youtube\resources\app.asar\src\downloader.js", line 57, in Socket.<anonymous>
  File "node:events", line 518, in Socket.emit
  File "node:internal/streams/readable", line 561, in addChunk
  File "node:internal/streams/readable", line 512, in readableAddChunkPushByteMode
  File "node:internal/streams/readable", line 392, in Readable.push
  File "node:internal/stream_base_commons", line 191, in Pipe.onStreamRead
```
content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The application should not crash with an ENOSPC error when attempting to write to a full disk.
Users should be informed via an appropriate message when there is insufficient disk space to complete an operation.
The application should gracefully handle scenarios where the disk becomes full during an ongoing write operation, preventing data corruption or loss where possible.

fileActions.explanation: To understand the context of `Object.info` at line 312 and what data is being written, which leads to the ENOSPC error.
To understand the context of the `Socket.<anonymous>` function at line 57 and how it interacts with file writing operations during downloading.
